Items.Title: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called the Meeting to order.
Roll Call
The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum
Supplemental Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting an amended certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City, the NYC Transitional Finance Authority, the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, the NYS Dormitory Authority and the NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation may soundly incur for capital projects for Fiscal Year 2006 and the ensuing three fiscal years, and the maximum amount of appropriations and expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year, pursuant to Section 250 (16) of the NY City Charter.

Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting an amended certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves.

Items.Title: RESOLUTION COMPUTING AND CERTIFYING BASE PERCENTAGE, CURRENT PERCENTAGE AND CURRENT BASE PROPORTION OF EACH CLASS OF REAL PROPERTY FOR FISCAL 2006 TO THE STATE BOARD OF REAL PROPERTY SERVICES PURSUANT TO SECTION 1803-a, REAL PROPERTY TAX LAW.

Items.MatterName: Computing and certifying base percentage, current percentage and current base proportion of each class of real property for Fiscal 2006.

Items.Title: RESOLUTION TO ADOPT A BUDGET APPROPRIATING THE AMOUNTS NECESSARY FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK AND THE COUNTIES THEREIN AND FOR THE PAYMENT OF INDEBTEDNESS THEREOF, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR BEGINNING ON JULY 1, 2005 AND ENDING ON JUNE 30, 2006 IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE CHARTER OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Expense Revenue Contract Budget, for FY'06

Items.Title: RESOLUTION TO ADOPT A CONTRACT BUDGET SETTING FORTH, BY AGENCY, CATEGORIES OF CONTRACTUAL SERVICES FOR WHICH APPROPRIATIONS HAD BEEN PROPOSED FOR THE FISCAL YEAR BEGINNING ON JULY 1, 2005 AND ENDING ON JUNE 30, 2006, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE CHARTER OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Expense Revenue Contract Budget, for FY'06

Items.Title: RESOLUTION BY THE New York CITY COUNCIL PURSUANT TO SECTION 254 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, THAT THE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2006 AND CAPITAL PROGRAM, BEING THE EXECUTIVE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2006 AND PROGRAM AS SUBMITTED BY THE MAYOR ON MAY 5, 2005, AND BY THE BOROUGH PRESIDENTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 249 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, INCLUDING RESCINDMENT OF AMOUNTS FROM PRIOR CAPITAL BUDGETS, BE AND THE SAME ARE HEREBY APPROVED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOLLOWING SCHEDULE OF CHANGES (RESOLUTION A)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Executive Capital Budget for FY'O6

Items.Title: RESOLUTION BY THE NEW YORK CITY COUNCIL PURSUANT TO SECTION 254 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, THAT THE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2006 AND CAPITAL PROGRAM FOR THE ENSUING THREE YEARS, AS SET FORTH IN THE EXECUTIVE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2006 AND CAPITAL PROGRAM AS SUBMITTED BY THE MAYOR ON MAY 5, 2005, AS AUGMENTED BY THE BOROUGH PRESIDENTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 249 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, AND AMENDED BY THE SCHEDULE OF CHANGES APPROVED UNDER RESOLUTION A, INCLUDING AMOUNTS REALLOCATED BY THE RESCINDMENT OF AMOUNTS FROM PRIOR CAPITAL BUDGET APPROPRIATIONS, IS HEREBY ADOPTED IN THE TOTAL AMOUNTS AS FOLLOWS. (RESOLUTION B)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Executive Capital Budget for FY'O6

Items.Title: RESOLUTION APPROVING THE FISCAL YEAR 2006 COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM, REALLOCATION OF THIRTY FIRST YEAR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FUNDS, AND THE PROPOSED THIRTY SECOND YEAR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Proposed City FY'06 Community Development Program, the Proposed CFY'06 Budget, the Proposed Reallocations-the CD XXXI Funds, Proposed CD XXXII Statement of Objectives and Budget, dated May 5, 2005.

Items.Title: RESOLUTION APPROVING, PURSUANT TO SECTION 2590-p OF THE STATE EDUCATION LAW AND PARAGRAPH(1)(a) OF THE MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING DATED JUNE 24, 2004 BETWEEN THE MAYOR, THE SPEAKER AND THE CHANCELLOR,  THE AMENDMENT TO THE FIVE YEAR EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES CAPITAL PLAN FOR 2005 - 2009 SUBMITTED BY THE CHANCELLOR IN A COMMUNICATION DATED JUNE 29, 2005.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: The Annual Amendment to the five-year educational facilities capital plan for 2005-2009.

Items.Title: Resolution to provide the amounts necessary for the support of the Government of the City of New York and the counties therein and for the payment of indebtedness thereof, for the Fiscal Year beginning on July 1, 2005 and ending on June 30, 2006 by the levy of taxes on the Real Property in the City of New York, in accordance with the provisions of the constitution of the State of New York, the Real Property Tax Law and the Charter of the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Approving a resolution of the Council of the City of New York fixing the tax rate for the FY'06, adopted June 30, 2005.

Items.Title: RESOLUTION APPROVING THE MODIFICATION (MN-6) OF UNITS OF APPROPRIATION AND THE TRANSFER OF CITY FUNDS BETWEEN AGENCIES PROPOSED BY THE MAYOR PURSUANT TO SECTION 107(b) OF THE CHARTER OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: M 605 - Transfer City funds between various agencies in fiscal year 2005 to implement changes to the City’s expense budget. (MN - 6)

Items.Title: Resolution approving a modification purusant to section 107(e) of the Charter of the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: M 606 - Appropriate new revenues of $2.2 billion in fiscal year 2005. (MN - 7)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to maintain weekend express service from Brooklyn to Midtown Manhattan beyond the scheduled June 30, 2005 termination date.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: MTA to maintain weekend express service from Brooklyn to Midtown Manhattan beyond the scheduled June 30, 2005 termination date.

Items.Title: RESOLUTION BY THE NEW YORK CITY COUNCIL PURSUANT TO SECTION 254 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, THAT THE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2006 AND CAPITAL PROGRAM FOR THE ENSUING THREE YEARS, AS SET FORTH IN THE EXECUTIVE CAPITAL BUDGET FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2006 AND CAPITAL PROGRAM AS SUBMITTED BY THE MAYOR ON MAY 5, 2005, AS AUGMENTED BY THE BOROUGH PRESIDENTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 249 OF THE NEW YORK CITY CHARTER, AND AMENDED BY THE SCHEDULE OF CHANGES APPROVED UNDER RESOLUTION A, INCLUDING AMOUNTS REALLOCATED BY THE RESCINDMENT OF AMOUNTS FROM PRIOR CAPITAL BUDGET APPROPRIATIONS, IS HEREBY ADOPTED IN THE TOTAL AMOUNTS AS FOLLOWS. (RESOLUTION B)
Items.MatterName: Executive Capital Budget for FY'O6

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: 

Int No. 431-A and M-641 & Res No. 1071.


See files for individual votes.
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Editor's Note:  Due to time considerations, the General Order items M-605 & Res No. 161 and M-606 & Res No. 1062 were voted on earlier in the Meeting immediately after the announcement of the presence of the quorum and before the Supplemental Messages and Papers from the Mayor.

At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the Executive Expense and Revenue Budget, the Executive Capital Budget for Fiscal Year 2006 and the Capital Program for the three succeeding fiscal years, all as modified, in accordance with Section 120 (b) and Section 222A of the New York City Charter, are hereby adopted on Thursday, June 30, 2005 at 2:05 p.m.
